result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W Scheidegger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Defn to continue seeing his therapist regularly. Defn to take all medication as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey W Scheidegger

defendant.name: Scheidegger, Jeffrey W
defendant.address: 4147 Vilas Hope Rd, Cottage Grove, WI 53527

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Final pre-trial on September 15, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Judge - Br 7

Defendant appeared.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 09:15 am.
